title: Are flamethrower drones being used to fight forest fires by controlled burning? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is actually NOT a crazy-ass question! LOL Good job! Yes, the NFS wants to buy and operate drones to start and monitor prescribed burns. It is substantially safer than sending people into the boonies with incendiaries, and have them hike in and out, and drones can provide excellent monitoring - arguably bots in the air are better than boots on the ground! (I couldn’t help myself - sorry!) Not gonna happen, though. As you can imagine, these would be prone to injury, and you need replacement parts. The replacement parts are in China (where just about everything is manufactured) and Trump signed an Executive Order banning the US Government from buying from China! Yeah, Mr. “Rake the Forests”.
I have not heard of any drones being used. Could be in the future. A helitorch is used now. Model 5400 - Simplex Aerospace
